column4: MB20: Yes.  I usually use make-dpkg when building, which makes everything easy.  The command should be something like "sudo make-kpkg --initrd --append-to-version=-2 kernel_image"

MB20: That command (executed in /usr/src/linux-source-whatever) will make a dpkg in the /usr/src directory.  It can be installed with dpkg -i, and will edit the kernel list in /boot/grub/*lst automagically.
